page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content: been used for later settlements. There was a new Lairds Mansion built near the present Sumburgh Hotel in the 17th century. All the Lairds were fiercely disliked as they were harsh rulers. The Lairds came from Scotland as Shetland had been transferred as part of the king of Norway's daughter's dowry. Princess Margaret married James 3 future king of Scotland. Many Cairns, Burnt Mounds and archaeological sites are to be found in our area. More recently evidence of Shetland's part in the two World Wars can be seen in old gun sites and air raid shelters. Also there have been several plane crashes. The worst happened in July 1979 when 17 people died. Our area attracts many archaeologists and new sites are continually found.
